intro: Astragalus leonardii, commonly known as Leonard's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and open woodlands. It has adapted to survive in harsh conditions with deep root systems and drought tolerance. Astragalus leonardii plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
